Title: Meeting with boss

Title: Sunday morning run
Paragraph: It's Sunday morning and you just ran a mile outside. Taking off your running shoes in the hallway, you are short of breath. You feel proud.
Questions: You should grab
MCQ_Positive: A bottle of water and a post-workout snack.
MCQ_Negative: Your inhaler because you are probably having an asthma attack.

Title: Office fundraising
Paragraph: You are put in charge of your office’s fundraising efforts and quickly realize that your coworkers are not very interested in the fundraising. At a meeting, you give a presentation about the importance of helping with the fundraising, during which your coworkers are quiet. As you sit down after your presentation, you think your coworkers seem eager.
Questions: Your coworkers are probably thinking
MCQ_Positive: That they want to help you with the fundraiser.

Title: Outing with family and friends
Paragraph: You organize a day outside with family and friends. The outing does not go very well, and you feel disappointed. As you get into your car, you think that others thought the event did not go well because of rain.

Title: Story in the news
Paragraph: You are having a conversation with a coworker about a recent story in the news. You voice your opinion, and your coworker disagrees. In the future, you expect your coworker’s feelings about you will be unchanged.

Title: Presentation at work
Paragraph: You are required to give a presentation to a group of work colleagues that you know well. They all are quiet during your presentation. As you think about the presentation later at home, you think that your colleagues found your presentation interesting.
Questions: Your colleagues were probably quiet because
MCQ_Positive: They were engaged by your  presentation.
MCQ_Negative: They were bored by your presentation.

Title: Finishing a computer course

Title: Disagreement at work

Title: Introductory meeting
Paragraph: Your new supervisor calls a meeting to meet everyone and asks each of you in turn to present yourself and your area of expertise. When it is your turn to speak, you pause frequently. As you reflect on the meeting later in the day, you feel that the supervisor thought you sounded unprepared.

Title: Book club
Paragraph: You meet someone new at a book club and have a stimulating discussion. Towards the end you find that she disagrees with something that you said. When the book club meets next, you expect that you will be included.
Questions: Upon meeting again, you think that
MCQ_Positive: Other members will be excited to hear your valuable contributions.
MCQ_Negative: Other members will exclude you because of your opinions.

Title: New teacher
Paragraph: A new teacher is hired for your history class, and you hear that he is very disciplined and hard-working. You meet him for the first time and discuss your work and interests. Getting up to leave at the end of your meeting, you think that he found you to be intelligent.
Questions: The new teacher probably
MCQ_Positive: Enjoyed the interaction and thought you were well-informed.
MCQ_Negative: Disliked the interaction and thought you were unimpressive.

Title: Discussion with colleagues
Paragraph: During a discussion, you end up debating an issue with colleagues. You later discover that they found your views unusual. When the issue comes up again in a group conversation, you expect that you will be excluded.
Questions: When the topic arises again, your peers will probably
MCQ_Positive: Ask you to contribute to the conversation.

Title: Long day of shopping
Paragraph: After a long day of shopping, you get onto a bus with a lot of bags and notice the only open seat is one that is facing another rider. As you sit down, the rider across from you doesn’t look at you. This is probably because he is lost in thought.
Questions: The rider across from you is probably
MCQ_Positive: Distracted and unaware of his surroundings.
MCQ_Negative: Thinking that you are an unfriendly person.

Title: Shopping for groceries
Paragraph: You are shopping in a grocery store. As you walk down an aisle, you cough very loudly into your sleeve, and other shoppers turn and glance your way. They probably think you're normal.
Questions: The other shoppers probably looked at you because
MCQ_Positive: They reflexively turned toward the sound.
MCQ_Negative: What you did was strange or rude.

Title: Health evaluation
Paragraph: At your routine doctor’s appointment, your doctor decides to run a few tests to evaluate your health. The doctor tells you that she will get you your results within a week. While you wait for your results, you think you are likely healthy.
Questions: You think that your results will reveal that
MCQ_Negative: Something is seriously wrong with your health.

Title: Long car ride

Title: House party
Paragraph: You are at a party with people you do not know well. You decide to join some people who are sitting on a couch and talking. When you try to enter the conversation, the people on the couch continue talking to each other, because they were probably distracted.

Title: Exploring a cave
Paragraph: You have decided to go on a tour of a cave, even though you feel nervous about being in such an enclosed space. As you go deep inside the first cave, you think the chances you will get trapped are small.
Questions: While you are in the cave, you will probably
MCQ_Negative: Not be able to find your way out.

Title: Weekend in town
Paragraph: It's the weekend and you are in town. You see a friend you haven't seen in ages. Your friend gives you a big hug, and you feel smothered. This feeling is nice.
Questions: While hugging your friend, you feel
MCQ_Negative: Like you can't catch your breath.

Title: Inviting work colleagues
Paragraph: You invite work colleagues to your house for a dinner party, although you know they don't always get along. At the dinner party, your guests talk a lot, despite not always agreeing. As you are clearing up afterwards, you think your guests found your party to be entertaining.
Questions: Your guests probably thought the dinner party was
MCQ_Positive: A success and a good idea.
MCQ_Negative: A failure and a bad idea.

Title: Leaving for vacation
Paragraph: It's the start of a long weekend and you are heading out for vacation. You leave before double-checking that all the appliances in your house are turned off. As you close the door to your house, you feel nervous.
Questions: While on vacation, you think about
MCQ_Positive: How much fun you are having.
MCQ_Negative: Whether you turned off the kitchen light.

Title: Dry mouth
Paragraph: You have experienced dry mouth for a few days. You wonder whether the dry mouth is a minor side effect from a medicine you just started taking, or something more serious. The likelihood that your dry mouth reflects a serious health problem is minimal.

Title: First day at a new job
Paragraph: It is your first day at a new job, and you report to your manager. As you approach her, you stumble then recover. She noticed, and her first impression of you is probably that you are very prepared.
Questions: Your manager will probably think that
MCQ_Positive: You are ready to take on challenges.

Title: New theater production
Paragraph: You are on the committee of an amateur theater group, which is planning a new production. At the first meeting, the director asks you for ideas about which play to perform. Everybody pauses after you say your ideas, and you think the others find your thoughts interesting.

Title: Waiting for a train
Paragraph: You are at a metro stop waiting for a train. Standing by the edge, you realize you've never thought about how far a drop it is to the rails below. You are fascinated.
Questions: While waiting for the train, you think about how
MCQ_Positive: You are safe standing above the tracks.
MCQ_Negative: You are in danger of falling over the edge.

Title: Tickling friend
Paragraph: Your friend is tickling you. As you laugh, you begin to feel short of breath. You start to feel excited.
Questions: Your shortness of breath probably means
MCQ_Positive: You are having fun and can't stop laughing.
MCQ_Negative: You are starting to have a panic attack.

Title: Busy week at work
Paragraph: Even though you normally excel at your job, you recently had a rough week at work. Specifically, you made a couple of mistakes on an important project. When you think about the future, you think it is likely that your job is secure.

Title: Trivia team tournament
Paragraph: You are persuaded to join a trivia team in a tournament. You are told that most of the questions will be asked of individuals, in different rounds. The first round is hard, but, looking around the table, you feel that the others found your efforts particularly admirable.
Questions: The people on your team most likely
MCQ_Positive: Are impressed by your trivia skills.
MCQ_Negative: Think you are bad at trivia.

Title: Cold winter
